XMLDB.COMMENT: ForumNG is a reimplemented variant of the original Moodle forum system. It provides asynchronous discussion facilities.

TABLE.NAME: forumng
TABLE.COMMENT: Standard module table. Holds information about a forum instance.

FIELD.NAME: course
FIELD.COMMENT: Moodle course ID

FIELD.NAME: name
FIELD.COMMENT: Name of activity.

FIELD.NAME: intro
FIELD.COMMENT: Introductory text that displays on the forum view page. This text is optional; if set to null, there is no such text.

FIELD.NAME: introformat
FIELD.COMMENT: Text format for intro field

FIELD.NAME: type
FIELD.COMMENT: Forum type that will be used to display this forum. May be NULL for default type.

FIELD.NAME: ratingscale
FIELD.COMMENT: 0 to disable ratings. Positive integer to use numeric 0..N scale. Negative number to select a scale by (negative) scale ID.

FIELD.NAME: ratingfrom
FIELD.COMMENT: Time (in seconds since epoch). Users can only rate posts that are created on or after this time. 0 if no limit.

FIELD.NAME: ratinguntil
FIELD.COMMENT: Time (in seconds since epoch). Users can only rate posts that were created before this time. 0 if no limit.

FIELD.NAME: ratingthreshold
FIELD.COMMENT: Required number of ratings. If a post receives fewer than this number of ratings, the average rating is not displayed or included in grades.

FIELD.NAME: grading
FIELD.COMMENT: 0 = no grade 1 = average rating 2 = count of ratings 3 = max of ratings 4 = min of ratings 5 = sum of ratings

FIELD.NAME: attachmentmaxbytes
FIELD.COMMENT: Maximum size of forum attachments in bytes.

FIELD.NAME: reportingemail
FIELD.COMMENT: Email address for reporting unacceptable post

FIELD.NAME: subscription
FIELD.COMMENT: Controls whether users can subscribe to this forum via email. 0 = subscription not permitted 1 = subscription permitted 2 = initially subscribed, can unsubscribe 3 = force subscribe

FIELD.NAME: feedtype
FIELD.COMMENT: Whether RSS/Atom feeds are permitted. 0 = no feed, 1 = discussions feed, 2 = all-posts feed.

FIELD.NAME: feeditems
FIELD.COMMENT: Number of articles included in RSS feed. 0 = site default.

FIELD.NAME: maxpostsperiod
FIELD.COMMENT: Time in seconds over which the maximum post counts are evaluated. (For example, if this is set to 1 day, and max posts is set to 10, then it will not let you post more than 10 posts in any 24-hour period.) 0 = no post restrictions.

FIELD.NAME: maxpostsblock
FIELD.COMMENT: After you make this many posts in the time period, you cannot post any more. 0 = not set.

FIELD.NAME: postingfrom
FIELD.COMMENT: If nonzero, then users cannot make posts or replies to the forum until the specified date.

FIELD.NAME: postinguntil
FIELD.COMMENT: If non-zero, users cannot make posts or replies to the forum after the specified date.

FIELD.NAME: typedata
FIELD.COMMENT: Stores arbitrary extra settings related to the forum type, if any; otherwise null. Data is stored as a serialized php object.

FIELD.NAME: magicnumber
FIELD.COMMENT: A random number generated when the forum is created. This is used (along with user ID, group ID) to create hashes that allow remote access to the RSS/Atom feeds for the forum, providing limited access security for the feeds.

FIELD.NAME: completiondiscussions
FIELD.COMMENT: Nonzero if a certain number of posts are required to mark this forum completed for a user.

FIELD.NAME: completionreplies
FIELD.COMMENT: Nonzero if a certain number of replies are required to mark this forum complete for a user.

FIELD.NAME: completionposts
FIELD.COMMENT: Nonzero if a certain number of posts or replies (total) are required to mark this forum complete for a user.

FIELD.NAME: removeafter
FIELD.COMMENT: Remove old discussions after certain period. 1 for one month, 2 for two months...12 for one year, 13 for two years and 14 for three years.

FIELD.NAME: removeto
FIELD.COMMENT: This field stores the mod instance id of the target forum. Null means delete old discussions permanently.

FIELD.NAME: shared
FIELD.COMMENT: If the forum is available for sharing on other courses, this flag will be set to 1.

FIELD.NAME: originalcmid
FIELD.COMMENT: If this forum is a reference to (clone of) a shared forum, this field is non-null and points to the original forum. (When this is set, other settings in this table are ignored.)

FIELD.NAME: gradingscale
FIELD.COMMENT: grading scale

FIELD.NAME: canpostanon
FIELD.COMMENT: This flag is set to 1 if the user can post anonymously as a moderator , 0 if not.

FIELD.NAME: tags
FIELD.COMMENT: field to indicate whether tags can be added to forumng discussions

FIELD.NAME: enableratings
FIELD.COMMENT: enable ratings

TABLE.NAME: forumng_discussions
TABLE.COMMENT: Represents a single discussion (thread) in a forum.

FIELD.NAME: forumngid
FIELD.COMMENT: Forum that contains this discussion

FIELD.NAME: groupid
FIELD.COMMENT: ID of group this discussion is in. NULL = any group

FIELD.NAME: postid
FIELD.COMMENT: ID within the forumng_posts table of the first post in this discussion. May be null, but only temporarily during discussion creation. (Note: This field may not point to a deleted post. If deleting the first post, you need to delete the whole discussion instead.)

FIELD.NAME: lastpostid
FIELD.COMMENT: ID of the most-recently updated post in this discussion. May be null, but only temporarily during discussion creation. (Note: This field may not point to a deleted post. If deleting a post that is referenced by this field, this field must be changed.)

FIELD.NAME: timestart
FIELD.COMMENT: If non-zero, this discussion does not appear until the given time.

FIELD.NAME: timeend
FIELD.COMMENT: If non-zero, the discussion disappears after the given time.

FIELD.NAME: deleted
FIELD.COMMENT: Set to the date at which the discussion was 'deleted'. Discussions can still be undeleted. A process in cron will 'really' delete discussions after a certain date.

FIELD.NAME: locked
FIELD.COMMENT: If set to 1, nobody can post to this discussion any more. The post pointed to by lastpostid is the post that was added while locking the thread.

FIELD.NAME: sticky
FIELD.COMMENT: If set to 1, this discussion appears in a special area at the top of the forum thread list.

FIELD.NAME: discussionid
FIELD.COMMENT: Discussion that contains this post.

FIELD.NAME: parentpostid
FIELD.COMMENT: ID of parent post within the same discussion; null if no parent (first post).

FIELD.NAME: userid
FIELD.COMMENT: User ID - must be a valid ID (not 0 or NULL).

FIELD.NAME: created
FIELD.COMMENT: Time originally created (seconds since epoch). This time remains the same if the post is edited.

FIELD.NAME: modified
FIELD.COMMENT: Time modified (seconds since epoch). Initially same as creation time. Changes if post is edited.

FIELD.NAME: deleted
FIELD.COMMENT: Normally 0. If this post was deleted, this field stores the time at which it was deleted. Posts may be 'really' removed from the database later by cron.

FIELD.NAME: deleteuserid
FIELD.COMMENT: If the post has been deleted, this field stores the ID of the user who deleted it. Null if the post has not been deleted.

FIELD.NAME: important
FIELD.COMMENT: If important is equal to 1, highlight the post. Default value is 0.

FIELD.NAME: mailstate
FIELD.COMMENT: 0 = post has not been mailed yet. 1 = post has not been mailed, is set to 'mail now'. 2 = post has been mailed. 3 = post has been mailed and included in any digests.

FIELD.NAME: oldversion
FIELD.COMMENT: 0 for all current posts. When a post is edited, a copy of the previous version is added to this table. The copy has this field set to 1, and the parentpostid field set to the ID of the real post. These extra copies may be deleted periodically via cron.

FIELD.NAME: edituserid
FIELD.COMMENT: If the post has been edited, this field stores the ID of the user who made this edit. (For posts with oldversion set to 0, this field will correspond to the user who made that previous edit.) Null if the post has not been edited.

FIELD.NAME: subject
FIELD.COMMENT: Contains the message subject. May be null if there is no change in subject (the system will automatically generate 'Re: whatever' in the appropriate language when necessary).

FIELD.NAME: message
FIELD.COMMENT: Actual text of message in format specified by format field.

FIELD.NAME: messageformat
FIELD.COMMENT: Format of text in the 'message' field, e.g. FORMAT_HTML.

FIELD.NAME: attachments
FIELD.COMMENT: This flag is set to 1 if there are attachments, 0 if not. Information (count, names, sizes) about the attachments in the post must be obtained by accessing the filesystem folder related to this post ID.

FIELD.NAME: asmoderator
FIELD.COMMENT: This flag is set to 1 if the user is a moderator, 0 if not.

INDEX.NAME: created
INDEX.COMMENT: Index on creation date. Used when building remote feeds.

FIELD.NAME: userid
FIELD.COMMENT: ID of user who rated post

FIELD.NAME: postid
FIELD.COMMENT: ID of post that was rated.

FIELD.NAME: time
FIELD.COMMENT: Time at which rating was given (or last updated).

FIELD.NAME: rating
FIELD.COMMENT: Actual rating. The meaning of this value depends on the scale used.

TABLE.NAME: forumng_subscriptions
TABLE.COMMENT: Stores list of users who are subscribed to a forum by email. Note that this list is not used if 'force subscription' or 'prevent subscription' options are selected.

FIELD.NAME: userid
FIELD.COMMENT: ID of user who will receive forum email.

FIELD.NAME: forumngid
FIELD.COMMENT: ID of forum that subscription relates to.

FIELD.NAME: subscribed
FIELD.COMMENT: This field is usually 1. It indicates that the user has chosen to subscribe to the forum. In the case of initial-subscription forums it may be 0, indicating that the user has chosen to unsubscribe. (If the user has not changed the default state, there would be no row for them in this table.)

FIELD.NAME: discussionid
FIELD.COMMENT: User has subscribed to this discussion if not NULL.

FIELD.NAME: clonecmid
FIELD.COMMENT: Used only for shared forums. This records the clone forum that you subscribed from. It is used in order to correctly determine your course when sending out emails. Note this field is not strictly necessary because you could use the forumngid field instead, but that makes the email queries even more complicated, so I added this field instead. (For non-clone forums it is always null.)

FIELD.NAME: groupid
FIELD.COMMENT: The group you subscribe to.

TABLE.NAME: forumng_read
TABLE.COMMENT: Tracks information about who has read each discussion, and when. Note that information here is only retained for recent discussions; older discussions are assumed to be read.

FIELD.NAME: userid
FIELD.COMMENT: ID of user who's read the discussion

FIELD.NAME: discussionid
FIELD.COMMENT: ID of discussion the user has read.

FIELD.NAME: time
FIELD.COMMENT: Time at which they read the discussion.

FIELD.NAME: postid
FIELD.COMMENT: Post id

INDEX.NAME: time
INDEX.COMMENT: Index time as we delete records older than certain time

TABLE.NAME: forumng_drafts
TABLE.COMMENT: Draft messages that have not yet been posted.

FIELD.NAME: userid
FIELD.COMMENT: User who wrote this draft post.

FIELD.NAME: forumngid
FIELD.COMMENT: Forum where the draft might be posted.

FIELD.NAME: groupid
FIELD.COMMENT: When creating a new discussion in a group-mode forum, this field should be set to indicate the group for the discussion. (null = 'all groups', or for use in a non-grouped forum). This field is not set when replying to an existing discussion, even if it is in a group.

FIELD.NAME: parentpostid
FIELD.COMMENT: If this draft is of a reply (rather than a new discussion), then this contains the id of the post it's replying to. New discussions are null.

FIELD.NAME: subject
FIELD.COMMENT: Message subject. Should be null if this reply does not change the subject.

FIELD.NAME: message
FIELD.COMMENT: Text of message (required, but may be empty string).

FIELD.NAME: messageformat
FIELD.COMMENT: Identifier for Moodle format (e.g. HTML) used for message content.

FIELD.NAME: attachments
FIELD.COMMENT: Set to 1 if this draft contains any attachments, 0 otherwise. Attachment files themselves can be determined based on contents of the relevant folder.

FIELD.NAME: saved
FIELD.COMMENT: Time last saved in seconds since epoch. (Note: Unlike the created/modified times in forumng_posts, the 'saved' time is used for both states here.)

FIELD.NAME: options
FIELD.COMMENT: This field may be set to contain serialised/encoded values of additional form fields, depending on the state of the form when the draft was created.

TABLE.NAME: forumng_flags
TABLE.COMMENT: Users can flag individual posts that are of interest. These are listed directly on the forum discussion list page.

FIELD.NAME: userid
FIELD.COMMENT: User who has flagged the post.

FIELD.NAME: postid
FIELD.COMMENT: ID of post that has been flagged.

FIELD.NAME: flagged
FIELD.COMMENT: Time (seconds since epoch) that the post was flagged.

FIELD.NAME: discussionid
FIELD.COMMENT: discussion id for flagging discussions
